National Electric Vehicle Infrastructure (NEVI)

The NEVI Program, established through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, will provide New York with more than $175 million over 5 years to help establish a seamless network of fast chargers across the state.

NEVI and New York

Find Your Nearest EV Charging Station

Water Infrastructure and State Revolving Funds

Through the Environmental Bond Act and State Revolving Funds supported by the federal government, New York is investing hundreds of millions of dollars in critical water infrastructure projects to ensure New Yorkers have access to safe and clean drinking water all over the state.

Clean Water Grants

Drinking Water Grants

Request a Meeting with the Community Assistance Teams

ConnectALL: Broadband Program

Through the ConnectALL program, New York is investing more than $1 billion to ensure that all New Yorkers have access to broadband internet services.

ConnectALL Program Overview

NYS Broadband Map

Environmental Bond Act

In 2022, New Yorkers overwhelmingly approved a ballot measure leading to the passage of the Environmental Bond Act, which is driving more than $4.2 billion of investments in clean water, reducing pollution, and protecting communities from harmful effects of climate change.

Program Overview and Priorities

Funding Opportunities and Program Updates

Watch Virtual Listening Sessions

Environmental Justice

Underserved communities are disproportionately harmed by the effects of climate change and pollution. New York’s steadfast commitment to environmental justice ensures that these communities benefit from the historic investments that the state is making in climate and the environment.

Climate Justice Working Group

Disadvantaged Communities Criteria

EPA EJ Thriving Communities Technical Assistance Centers Program

Downtown Revitalization Initiative (DRI) and NY Forward Program

DRI is a cornerstone of New York's economic development program helping to transform downtown neighborhoods into vibrant centers that offer a high quality of life and are magnets for redevelopment, business, job creation, and economic and housing diversity. NY Forward builds on the success of DRI by invigorating downtowns in the State’s smaller and rural communities—the type of downtowns found in villages, hamlets and other small, neighborhood-scale municipal centers.
